title: Job Openings at Dealclinchers Homes Limited
content:
Dealclinchers Homes Limited is committed to revolutionizing the real estate experience, ensuring everyone finds their ideal home for a life of comfort and contentment.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Legal Officer

Job Locations: Abuja

Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@dealclinchersltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Sales Executive

Job Locations: Lagos

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@dealclinchersltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Driver

Job Locations: Lagos

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@dealclinchersltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head of Sales (Retail & Corporate)",
  "description": "Casava, an Insurtech in the Nigerian space, is reimagining how insurance should impact lives. Our vision is to make insurance commonplace for individuals and small businesses in Nigeria and across the continent. We are building the next-gen digital insurance for Africa, making insurance affordable, valuable, and convenient, powered by technology and behavioural economics. We incorporate trustworthy, transparent, innovative, pioneering, empathetic, and impactful values into our business model, product, work culture, and brand.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head of Sales (Retail &amp; Corporate)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full Time

What we are looking for&nbsp;


	We are seeking a Head of Retail and Corporate Sales who will be responsible for leading and executing the sales strategy within the retail and agency channels.
	This role requires a dynamic leader with a proven track record of driving growth in the retail sector and managing agency partnerships.
	The ideal candidate will oversee the development and performance of sales teams, ensuring the successful execution of sales targets, market expansion, and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
In this role, you&rsquo;ll be responsible for;


	Develop and implement the retail and corporate sales strategy, aligning it with the company&#39;s broader business goals and market dynamics.
	Lead, manage, and mentor the retail and corporate sales teams, providing direction, training, and performance management to achieve sales objectives.
	Drive the expansion of the retail sales network by identifying and opening new retail channels and agency partnerships.
	Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to develop promotional campaigns, product offerings, and customer engagement strategies that enhance sales in the retail and agency sectors.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key retail partners and agencies, ensuring alignment and execution of sales goals.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to adapt strategies and ensure that Casava remains competitive in the retail space.
	Track, analyze, and report on sales performance, using data to refine sales tactics and ensure the achievement of targets across retail and agency channels.
	Oversee contract negotiations and deal closures with retail partners and agencies, ensuring that all agreements support the company&rsquo;s sales goals and revenue targets.
	Ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies, maintaining high standards of ethical sales practices.
	Develop and manage the retail and agency sales budget, optimizing resources and ensuring a high return on investment.
	Foster a customer-centric sales culture, ensuring that customer experience and service excellence are priorities in all sales efforts.


The right candidate might have


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field; an MBA or relevant professional certifications is an advantage.
	Minimum of 7 - 10 years of experience in retail or agency sales, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
	Proven track record of successfully driving sales growth and managing sales teams in retail and agency channels.
	Strong leadership skills with the ability to develop and inspire high-performing teams.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
	Experience in contract negotiation, budget management, and performance reporting.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
	Familiarity with the insurance or financial services sector is a plus.


What we offer


	Culture: We create a culture based on empathy, excellence, integrity, innovation, and creativity.
	Career Progression: Not only do we offer exciting challenges to work on, but we also want you to grow with us. We invest in career development and training(s) to support your aspirations.
	Empowerment: We don&#39;t believe in the traditional hierarchy and ensure everyone has a voice. We incorporate all perspectives into our plans, from open-door policies to collaborative processes.
	Flexibility: We are building a workplace that allows you to be you. For example, we are working hybrid, where 2 out of 5 days are remote to allow work life balance.
	Remuneration: Our Salary package is highly competitive in the market
	Other Benefits: Office lunch for full-time employees, and a standard Health Insurance cover.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their&nbsp;updated CV to:&nbsp;humans@casava.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	We are at an early stage, so now is the perfect time to join if you enjoy building and the challenges that come with it.
	We are small, agile, and moving like a rocket.&nbsp;We would love to meet you!
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-10",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Casava Microinsurance Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Head of Sales (Retail & Corporate) Job at Casava Microinsurance Limited




        
    

        
        Casava, an Insurtech in the Nigerian space, is reimagining how insurance should impact lives. Our vision is to make insurance commonplace for individuals and small businesses in Nigeria and across the continent. We are building the next-gen digital insurance for Africa, making insurance affordable, valuable, and convenient, powered by technology and behavioural economics. We incorporate trustworthy, transparent, innovative, pioneering, empathetic, and impactful values into our business model, product, work culture, and brand.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Sales (Retail & Corporate)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



What we are looking for 


	We are seeking a Head of Retail and Corporate Sales who will be responsible for leading and executing the sales strategy within the retail and agency channels.
	This role requires a dynamic leader with a proven track record of driving growth in the retail sector and managing agency partnerships.
	The ideal candidate will oversee the development and performance of sales teams, ensuring the successful execution of sales targets, market expansion, and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
In this role, you’ll be responsible for;


	Develop and implement the retail and corporate sales strategy, aligning it with the company's broader business goals and market dynamics.
	Lead, manage, and mentor the retail and corporate sales teams, providing direction, training, and performance management to achieve sales objectives.
	Drive the expansion of the retail sales network by identifying and opening new retail channels and agency partnerships.
	Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to develop promotional campaigns, product offerings, and customer engagement strategies that enhance sales in the retail and agency sectors.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key retail partners and agencies, ensuring alignment and execution of sales goals.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to adapt strategies and ensure that Casava remains competitive in the retail space.
	Track, analyze, and report on sales performance, using data to refine sales tactics and ensure the achievement of targets across retail and agency channels.
	Oversee contract negotiations and deal closures with retail partners and agencies, ensuring that all agreements support the company’s sales goals and revenue targets.
	Ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies, maintaining high standards of ethical sales practices.
	Develop and manage the retail and agency sales budget, optimizing resources and ensuring a high return on investment.
	Foster a customer-centric sales culture, ensuring that customer experience and service excellence are priorities in all sales efforts.


The right candidate might have


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field; an MBA or relevant professional certifications is an advantage.
	Minimum of 7 - 10 years of experience in retail or agency sales, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
	Proven track record of successfully driving sales growth and managing sales teams in retail and agency channels.
	Strong leadership skills with the ability to develop and inspire high-performing teams.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
	Experience in contract negotiation, budget management, and performance reporting.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
	Familiarity with the insurance or financial services sector is a plus.


What we offer


	Culture: We create a culture based on empathy, excellence, integrity, innovation, and creativity.
	Career Progression: Not only do we offer exciting challenges to work on, but we also want you to grow with us. We invest in career development and training(s) to support your aspirations.
	Empowerment: We don't believe in the traditional hierarchy and ensure everyone has a voice. We incorporate all perspectives into our plans, from open-door policies to collaborative processes.
	Flexibility: We are building a workplace that allows you to be you. For example, we are working hybrid, where 2 out of 5 days are remote to allow work life balance.
	Remuneration: Our Salary package is highly competitive in the market
	Other Benefits: Office lunch for full-time employees, and a standard Health Insurance cover.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: humans@casava.co using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	We are at an early stage, so now is the perfect time to join if you enjoy building and the challenges that come with it.
	We are small, agile, and moving like a rocket. We would love to meet you!
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Officer",
  "description": "TradingPRO is a leading financial technology company that provides cutting-edge trading platforms and services to traders worldwide. We are committed to innovation, excellence, and empowering our clients to achieve their financial goals.

Our team consists of passionate professionals from diverse backgrounds who share a common vision of revolutionizing the trading industry through technology and exceptional service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and enthusiastic Marketer/ surveying officer for our investment company.
	The role involves raising brand awareness, promoting our products and services, engaging prospects, and supporting the implementation of marketing campaigns.
	You will work closely with the Sales and Marketing team to communicate the value of our investment packages, gather client feedback, and represent the brand at events, launches, and field surveys.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote company products and services to increase sales and brand visibility.
	Conduct market surveys to identify new opportunities and better understand client needs.
	Act as the face and voice of the brand, ensuring consistent and professional representation.
	Support the execution of marketing campaigns and outreach programs.
	Engage potential clients by explaining the value and benefits of investment packages.
	Collect and track feedback from clients and prospects to improve services.
	Represent the company at product launches, seminars, exhibitions, and events.
	Collaborate with the Sales and Marketing department to achieve set goals and targets.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE qualification, OND qualification, HND qualification, or B.Sc. Degree in any relevant field.
	Prior experience in customer service, marketing, or sales is an added advantage.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Friendly, approachable, and outgoing personality.
	Ability to adapt, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
	Willingness to travel as required.


Benefits


	Comprehensive in-house training provided.
	Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company.
	Performance incentives &amp; other benefits


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;seyosuperb@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Marketing Officer Job at TradingPRO




        
    

        
        TradingPRO is a leading financial technology company that provides cutting-edge trading platforms and services to traders worldwide. We are committed to innovation, excellence, and empowering our clients to achieve their financial goals.

Our team consists of passionate professionals from diverse backgrounds who share a common vision of revolutionizing the trading industry through technology and exceptional service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive and enthusiastic Marketer/ surveying officer for our investment company.
	The role involves raising brand awareness, promoting our products and services, engaging prospects, and supporting the implementation of marketing campaigns.
	You will work closely with the Sales and Marketing team to communicate the value of our investment packages, gather client feedback, and represent the brand at events, launches, and field surveys.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote company products and services to increase sales and brand visibility.
	Conduct market surveys to identify new opportunities and better understand client needs.
	Act as the face and voice of the brand, ensuring consistent and professional representation.
	Support the execution of marketing campaigns and outreach programs.
	Engage potential clients by explaining the value and benefits of investment packages.
	Collect and track feedback from clients and prospects to improve services.
	Represent the company at product launches, seminars, exhibitions, and events.
	Collaborate with the Sales and Marketing department to achieve set goals and targets.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE qualification, OND qualification, HND qualification, or B.Sc. Degree in any relevant field.
	Prior experience in customer service, marketing, or sales is an added advantage.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Friendly, approachable, and outgoing personality.
	Ability to adapt, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
	Willingness to travel as required.


Benefits


	Comprehensive in-house training provided.
	Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company.
	Performance incentives & other benefits


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: seyosuperb@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Shift Manager",
  "description": "Total Data Limited is a management consultancy firm specializing in the provision of Human Resources and Manpower solutions to its&rsquo; clients across Nigeria. We focus on providing additional and exceptional services through value added, and end-to-end HR services to our clients; helping them maximize and build operational efficiency.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Shift Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full time
Industry Manufacturing

Job Description


	Direct and coordinate the activities of employees engaged in the production and loading of goods such as Loaders and Pallets.
	Recommend or execute personnel actions, such as hirings, evaluations, or promotions.
	Maintain operations data, such as time records, production, expense and prepare production reports for the management.
	Ensure the production and logistics process remains smooth and efficient by monitoring operation workers and organizing work flow.


Responsibilities&nbsp;


	Continuous recruitment, orientation and training of factory operatives.
	Plan and establish work schedules, assignments, and sequences to meet client&rsquo;s projected expectations.
	Set standards and specified targets for new operatives.
	Enforcement of Clients/TDL rules and regulations.
	Effective management of the operatives&rsquo; activities in line with client&rsquo;s requirement.
	Efficient resolution of issues
	Effective management of work activities and attendance records.
	Prompt submission of work done at the end of every shift.
	Implementation of efficient cost management strategies such as manpower management, PPE management, and proper product/machine handling.
	Stakeholder and Conflict management.
	Maintain the security of all information entrusted to you and all members of staff.
	Enforce safety policies and procedures to decrease potential injuries for employee on the job at all times. [Strict Adherence to the usage of P.P.E(s)].


Benefits


	Health Insurance (HMO)
	Pension.

Shift Manager Job at Total Data Limited




        
    

        
        Total Data Limited is a management consultancy firm specializing in the provision of Human Resources and Manpower solutions to its’ clients across Nigeria. We focus on providing additional and exceptional services through value added, and end-to-end HR services to our clients; helping them maximize and build operational efficiency.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Shift Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time
Industry Manufacturing

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Direct and coordinate the activities of employees engaged in the production and loading of goods such as Loaders and Pallets.
	Recommend or execute personnel actions, such as hirings, evaluations, or promotions.
	Maintain operations data, such as time records, production, expense and prepare production reports for the management.
	Ensure the production and logistics process remains smooth and efficient by monitoring operation workers and organizing work flow.


Responsibilities 


	Continuous recruitment, orientation and training of factory operatives.
	Plan and establish work schedules, assignments, and sequences to meet client’s projected expectations.
	Set standards and specified targets for new operatives.
	Enforcement of Clients/TDL rules and regulations.
	Effective management of the operatives’ activities in line with client’s requirement.
	Efficient resolution of issues
	Effective management of work activities and attendance records.
	Prompt submission of work done at the end of every shift.
	Implementation of efficient cost management strategies such as manpower management, PPE management, and proper product/machine handling.
	Stakeholder and Conflict management.
	Maintain the security of all information entrusted to you and all members of staff.
	Enforce safety policies and procedures to decrease potential injuries for employee on the job at all times. [Strict Adherence to the usage of P.P.E(s)].


Benefits


	Health Insurance (HMO)
	Pension.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
